unnormalised: Hey everyone! Has anyone else been checking out adaptive learning platforms lately? I'm finding the whole concept pretty fascinating, especially for Indian students. Imagine a system that understands that Rohan from Delhi needs more help with quadratic equations, while Priya from Chennai is acing that but struggling with Trigonometry. That's adaptive learning in action!

unnormalised: Basically, it's EdTech that customizes the learning path based on your performance. Instead of a one-size-fits-all curriculum that might bore some and overwhelm others, it adapts! Think personalized learning like a bespoke kurta from a tailor in Chandni Chowk.

unnormalised: I've been researching various platforms and seen demos that incorporate things like AI to identify knowledge gaps and provide targeted exercises. Some even adjust the difficulty level in real-time, making sure students are constantly challenged, but not discouraged. It's supposed to boost engagement and lead to better outcomes. We're talking potentially higher scores on those competitive entrance exams for IIT or AIIMS!
